I love science, teach my kids science, and read Popular Science, but it annoys me when someone does philosophy (generally poorly) using scientific words. "Humans are just machines" is a statement of philosophy that if true and followed to its logical conclusion leads to material determinism, which means that the person saying it had no choice but to say it because he (or she) was predetermined by the molecules, law of the universe, etc. to say it. This robs the statement of any real meaning because both the sender and receiver of a message do not really have any free thoughts, but rather are simply input and output devices that have the illusion of thought. Consciousness is "just" an illusion.

In 80 ms the light can travel 24 000 000m , there simply no object on earth far enough to make a noticeable difference for our brain .

10 000 time(all that in 1 millisecond) before you brain can even start to process the information .

Even if our brain was able to process instantly the delay for a 30 meter object would be around 0.1microsecond ( 0.000 0001 sec) .
